resources.string: We would like to know how much effort you need in doing certain activities. For each of the following questions, please choose the number that corresponds to the effort that you need to do the following activities.
How much effort is it for you to:
Participate in social activities with family and/or friends?
Participate in recreational activities? (sports, hobbies, cards, etc.)
Spend your day doing an activity that is important to you?
Assume a role in your family?
Move around your community? (shopping, banking, etc.)
Deal with life events when they happen?
Be comfortable with your personal relationships?
Be comfortable with yourself when you are in the company of others?

We would like to know how restricted you feel in doing certain activities. For each of the following questions, please choose the number that corresponds to the amount of restriction that you feel in doing the following activities.
Participating in social activities with family and/or friends?
Participating in recreational activities? (sports, hobbies, cards, etc.)
Spending your day doing an activity that is important to you?
Assuming a role in your family?
Moving around your community? (shopping, banking, etc.)
Dealing with life events when they happen?
Feeling comfortable with your personal relationships?
Feeling comfortable with yourself when you are in the company of others?
If there was no one to help you with your feeding, could you do it alone?
If there was no one to help you with your personal hygiene, could you do it alone?
If there was no one to help you, would you be able to bathe or shower without anyone present?
If there was no one to help you, would you be able to dress yourself?
If there was no one to help you, would you be able to get to the toilet on your own?
Do you have any trouble with bowel incontinence?
Do you have any trouble with bladder control?
Can you transfer from bed to chair independently?
Can you walk 50 yards without help or supervision?
Can you go up and down stairs independently?
Can you get to places out of walking distance…
Can you go shopping for groceries or clothes (assuming has transportation)…
Can you prepare your own meals…
Can you do your own housework…
Can you take your own medicine…
Can you handle your own money…
without help, including looking up numbers and dialing
with some help (can answer the phone or dial the operator in an emergency, but needs a special phone or help in getting the number or dialing)
or are you completely unable to use the telephone
without help (can travel on buses, taxis or drive your own car)
with some help (need someone to help you or go with you when travelling
or are you unable to travel unless emergency arrangements are made for a specialized vehicle like an ambulance
without help (taking care of all shopping needs yourself assuming that you had transportation)
with some help (need someone to go with you on all shopping trips)
or are you completely unable to do any shopping
without help (plan and cook meals yourself)
with some help (can prepare some things but unable to cook full meals yourself)
or are you completely unable to prepare any meals
with some help (can do light housework but need help with heavy work)
or are you completely unable to do any housework
without help (in the right doses at the right time)
with some help (able to take medicine if someone prepares it for you and/or reminds you to take it)
or are you completely unable to take your own medicine
without help (write checks, pay bills, etc.)
with some help (manage day to day buying but need some help with managing cheque book and paying bills)
or are you completely unable to handle your own money
Are you basically satisfied with your life?
Do you feel that your life is empty?
Are you in good spirits most of the time?
Do you feel happy most of the time?
Do you think it is wonderful to be alive now?
Do you feel that your situation is hopeless?
How would you rate your overall health?
How much distress are you experiencing?
How much pain are you experiencing?
How much fatigue are you experiencing?
How much depression are you experiencing?
How much anxiety are you experiencing?
How many times do you remember falling in the last year?
Have any of the falls produced:
I feel full after eating only a few mouthfuls
I feel full after eating a third of a meal
I feel full after eating over half a meal
I feel full after eating most of the meal
Less than one meal a day
More than three meals a day
How would you best describe your ability to drive a car:
I can drive a car anywhere
I can drive a car in my neighbourhood avoiding traffic or highways
Which of the following best describes your walking speed:
How often do you get dizzy/lightheaded?
How often do you leak urine?
We would like to know how much urine you think leaks. How much urine do you usually leak (whether you wear protection or not)?
Overall, how much does leaking urine interfere with your everyday life?
About once a week or less often
Two or three times a week
Please indicate which statement best describes your own health state today
Usual Activities (e.g. work, study, housework, family or leisure activities)
I have no problems in walking about
I have some problems in walking about
I have no problems with self-care
I have some problems washing or dressing myself
I am unable to wash or dress myself
I have no problems with performing my usual activities
I have some problems with performing my usual activities
I am unable to perform my usual activities
I have no pain or discomfort
I have moderate pain or discomfort
I have extreme pain or discomfort
I am not anxious or depressed
I am moderately anxious or depressed
I am extremely anxious or depressed

To help people say how good or bad a health state is, we have drawn a scale on which the best state you can imagine is marked by 100 and the worst state you can imagine is marked by 0. \n\n We would like you to indicate on this scale how good or bad is your own health today, in your opinion. Please do this by selecting a point on the scale which indicates how good or bad your current health state is.
Are you always looking for something to do?
Do you have energy for daily activities?
Are you interested in learning new things?
Do you put much effort into things?
The following items are about activities you might do during a typical day. Does your health now limit you in these activities? If so, how much?
Vigorous activities, such as running, lifting heavy objects, participating in strenuous sports
Moderate activities, such as moving a table, pushing a vacuum cleaner, bowling, or playing golf

For each of the following, please indicate your level of confidence in doing the activity without losing your balance or becoming unsteady by choosing one of the percentage points on the scale from 0% to 100%. If you do not currently do the activity in question, try and imagine how confident you would be if you had to do the activity. If you normally use a walking aid to do the activity or hold onto someone, rate your confidence as if you were using these supports. If you have any questions about answering any of the items, please ask the administrator. \n\n For each of the following activities, please indicate your level of self-confidence by choosing a corresponding number from the rating scale
How confident are you that you will not lose your balance and become unsteady when you:
bend over and pick up a slipper from the front of a closet floor?
reach for a small can of a shelf at eye level?
stand on your tip toes and reach for something above your head?
stand on a chair and reach for something?
walk outside the house to a car parked in the driveway?
get into or out of a car?
walk across a parking lot to the mall?
walk up or down a ramp?
walk in a crowded mall where people rapidly walk past you?
are bumped into by people as you walk through a mall?
step onto or off of an escalator while holding onto a railing?
step onto or off of an escalator while holding onto parcels such that you cannot hold onto the railing?
During the past 4 weeks, how many days have you:
been to other rooms in your home besides the room where you sleep?
been to an area outside your home such as your porch, deck, or patio, hallway of an apartment building, garage?
been to places in your neighbourhood other than your own yard or apartment building?
been to places outside your neighbourhood, but within your town?
been to places outside your town?

We are conducting a study about how aging affects ability to function in everyday life. The study involves some simple tests of mobility and some questionnaires. We are asking your permission for a person from the research team to visit you and explain the study to you.
I (nurse) have introduced the study to the patient
Yes, the patient has agreed to have someone from the research team contact them to explain the study.
Patient with ID %1$s already exists. Do you wish to load this patient from the database?
